headline: Tyson Foods Is Dropping High-Fructose Corn Syrup
summary: The meat company’s pledge follows the Trump administration’s push to reduce usage of certain ingredients in food.

headline: Tyson Foods to stop using corn syrup in products in US by end of 2025
summary: Tyson Foods said on Monday it will stop using certain ingredients, like high-fructose corn syrup, in its products by the end of 2025 in the U.S.  Food companies are seeking alternative ingredients in response to Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr.'s "Make America Healthy Again" campaign that aims to eliminate artificial dyes from packaged foods sold in the country.  Kennedy has also been critical of the amount of sugar consumed in the American diet and has said that updated dietary guidelines will advise Americans to eat "whole food".

raw.headline: Tyson Foods to stop using corn syrup in products in US by end of 2025
raw.summary: Tyson Foods said on Monday it will stop using certain ingredients, like high-fructose corn syrup, in its products by the end of 2025 in the U.S.  Food companies are seeking alternative ingredients in response to Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr.'s "Make America Healthy Again" campaign that aims to eliminate artificial dyes from packaged foods sold in the country.  Kennedy has also been critical of the amount of sugar consumed in the American diet and has said that updated dietary guidelines will advise Americans to eat "whole food".

headline: Tyson Foods to stop using corn syrup in products by end of 2025
summary: The meatpacker said it will also stop using ingredients such as sucralose, titanium dioxide and the synthetic antioxidant BHA/BHT.  "We continuously review and assess our product portfolio to ensure the highest quality products that meet the needs of consumers," said Donnie King, CEO of Tyson Foods.

headline: Tyson Foods Plans to Stop Using High Fructose Corn Syrup and Other Ingredients in Its Branded Products
summary: SPRINGDALE, Ark., Sept. 15, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Tyson Foods is taking another proactive step forward in its mission to bring high-quality food to every table in the world, safely, sustainably and affordably now and for future generations. The company’s goal is to stop using High Fructose Corn Syrup, Sucralose, BHA/BHT and Titanium Dioxide in the production of branded products in the U.S. by the end of 2025. Those brands include Tyson®, Jimmy Dean®, Hillshire Farm®, Wright®, State Fair®, Aid

raw.headline: Tyson Foods Plans to Stop Using High Fructose Corn Syrup and Other Ingredients in Its Branded Products
raw.summary: SPRINGDALE, Ark., Sept. 15, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Tyson Foods is taking another proactive step forward in its mission to bring high-quality food to every table in the world, safely, sustainably and affordably now and for future generations. The company’s goal is to stop using High Fructose Corn Syrup, Sucralose, BHA/BHT and Titanium Dioxide in the production of branded products in the U.S. by the end of 2025. Those brands include Tyson®, Jimmy Dean®, Hillshire Farm®, Wright®, State Fair®, Aid
